sentence.text: He turned and motioned Carter to take the lead .
She subsided gracefully on to a mat and motioned Erika to join her .
She motioned him to stay .
Mother Bombie motioned him to keep his voice down but he ignored her .
She seated herself by the fireplace , and motioned the two men to sit .
He motioned Parker to sit down .
We followed the tweed skirt into a kitchen where its owner motioned us to sit , in the manner of someone training a dog .
With a practised hand the senior partner motioned a waiter to bring a fresh pot of coffee and five more pipes of tobacco .
He motioned the young officer to sit down .
He motioned them to chairs .
She sat back on the sofa and motioned him beside her .
When she saw me , she smiled and put a finger to her lips , motioning silence .
Anna opened the door and motioned Rachaela forward .
She motioned for the child to sit on her lap .
Jock looked up briefly , then motioned for her to hurry .
Nicholson motioned for him to sit down .
The gun motions for John to rise .
He motions for me to follow .
He motioned to the barman to refill their glasses , a feeling of satisfaction running through him .
He downed the dark , viscous liqueur in one go and motioned to Franco for more .
His wife motioned to him to be quiet as she moved around the counter .
Fakrid motioned to Jinkwa .
Rain motioned to Oliver that she was going upstairs .
Nicholson motioned to them to take a seat .
She motioned towards the tea-table .
He stared at her for a moment , then motioned with his head towards the door .
He motioned with his head to Antony , who nodded and went swiftly out of the room and up the stairs .
With a tired little toss of the head , she turned away and sat down in an armchair , motioning for Golding to do the same .
He motioned to Jack , who moved slightly away from the door , drawing Alison with him .
